Reviews.Title: “Very good cost-benefit.”
Reviews.Author: Adrianofc
Reviews.Content: Very good service, breakfast, clean rooms, new floors, entrance being refurbished, gentle reception. Delivers what it says it will. Note: a/c wasn't working and was allegedly turned off for the whole building, but wasn't needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Mercure Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located away from the city center but this is not a negative point and that is because the guest can stay away from the overcrowded city center. The hotel is near 2 bus stations (5 minutes walk max), one of them linking the metro station Bologna (3 stations to the hotel or 15 to 20 minutes walk) and the other linking the city centre. It somewhat tricky to find the exact location of the hotel as there are no signs to guide you, but if you print the map from the hotel site, or search a little at Gogglemaps or the town transport company site or just ask a local dweller there will no problem to find your way. After 1-2 days that you have learned to walk around easily there is no problem with the transport. The hotel is under some kind of refurbishing and the main entrance is closed so you have to enter from the side. The reception staff is VERY helpful and ready to answer every question about the surroundings, directions how to get everywhere even some tips where to eat at night in two lovely local trattorias. The room was quite spacious (larger than Ibis and smaller than Novotel), quiet, with new furnitures, there was stuff to make coffee and tea, 2 small bottles of water and 1 large, enough wall sockets, a soft bed with 3 soft pillows and a small safe inside the large closet. The bathroom was spacious, well equiped, clean, there was a hair dryer and 3 towels for each person. The only drawback I can find is that the large bathtube have a glass that is not covering all the side and if you are not careful you can easily pour water all over the place! In general I think that the room was refurbished recently and was looking brand new adding that little extra to make a guest happy with his selection. The breakfast was good enough mainly a "continental-style" breakfast, but I suppose there was a room to add some more bread types and 2-3 italian delicacies to give a local aroma. I stayed for 5 troublefree nights, not far away from the city center, in a quiet and lovely neighbouhood, I enjoyed my stay and I definitely recommend this hotel to everyone. P.S: Special thanks to the reception staff for helping us getting around, giving info about where to eat nearby at 21.00h and make a reservation for a tour at Tivoli (I can recommend this tour). Excellent and very professional staff!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Erwin_Widjaja
Reviews.Content: It has been a very nice stay at Mercure Roma Corso Trieste. The location is okay, it is about 15-20 mins walk from nearest Metro station (Piazza Bologna). However, those walks between hotel and metro station will be unique experiences as you will directly feel Rome's neighborhood :) (but please mind if you plan to carry heavy luggages) The hotel itself is neat and clean, the staffs are very helpful. One of the surprise is the very nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travel122
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed staying here, the rooms are a decent size and very clean and modern. We had the breakfast buffet which was very good. The staff spoke english and were very helpful. It is a bit far from the center of the city, but the surrounding neighborhood had good restaurants to choose from. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyboopinv
Reviews.Content: Cannot fault this hotel. Nice location, good room (with balcony). Pleasant breakfast, and for the most part, excellent staff. While a short distance from town, the bus services are regular and travel by varied routes, all of which are enjoyable viewing. Housekeeping is amongst the best I have experienced in the mid range bracket. My grandson and I frequented the good variation of local restaurants and cafes at night. All in all, this is a an excellent base from which to discover Rome.

Reviews.Title: “5 star service at a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ghassan Z
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights in January with my wife and 18 month old son, mum and sister. The hotel was exceptional in every way. The rooms were very clean, not to mention cleaned daily by very nice housekeepers. Towels were always fresh, free water in the fridge daily, couldn't have asked for more. If I wanted to be really picky, only thing I could mention is that all the channels on TV were Italian which isn't really great for tourists but who cares :) Buffet breakfast was good, rooms have balconies which was great and they provided a cot free of charge. The price was also very good. The highlight of our stay was the people at the front desk. They were extremely helpful on every occasion and very friendly. We did have to catch a taxi to and from the hotel so if you're planning on walking everywhere, this might not be the right hotel for you. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nicomedbxl
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at this hotel. Rooms are nicely furnished. Located in a nice & quiet residential area. English-speaking staff. Nice restaurants in the area. Buffet breakfast has a lot of products of average quality. Direct connection with Termini station (bus 38, 90 & 36) & Piazza Barberini (80). The only negative point would be the room cleaning service : old plastic glasses were left in the room, milk was left in a tea pot for 2 days, they forgot to leave clean towels...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: Copacabana_Ipanema Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very clean, the staff were very helpful and kind. The room was very clean, so as the bathroom. Both looked "as new". The breakfast was very good, plenty and of a good variety. We even drunk some wine at the bar, and it was a delightful experience.(red wine is served with parmigiano). All in all the hotel in itself is very very nice. Location : here are the drawbacks.. the hotel is reachable only by bus or car. The subway station (Bolognia) is quite far away. There are several bus stops in the near vicinity ( Corso/Istria for Express Bus 80 to Piazza Venezia (direct); or Nomentana / XX April for Express Bus 90 to Termini). To reach the hotel by cab, we paid to and from Fiumicino 50 EUR/trip. This is quite the same as paing 2*15 eur for the Leonardo express train to termini and then taking some other means of transportation to the Hotel. Overall, a nice experience. Ps. The Neighbourhood where the hotel is located is very nice, only classy old buildings, superb villas etc. So.. maybe during summer, when there is also more daylight, the travel to/from the hotel to/from Bologna subway station, might be a pleasant walk. (1 km = approx 15 min)

Reviews.Title: “Worst Location”
Reviews.Author: Guilherme R Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is great, but don't trust on the description on their site that the hotel is "only 2 km from the historic town centre". This is not fair. They might be referring to another historic town centre, not the ones that you expect to see in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel out from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Desdemona5
Reviews.Content: We stayed there 4 nights, the rooms were just perfect! I highlight the comfort and the furnishing of the rooms, with an excellent bed facility: extremely convenient bed! Just 10 minutes from Termini station, easy transport (even there was one day with transport strike). From Termini both airports can be easily and cheaply reached by Terravision shuttle bus service (I do recommend you not only in Rome!) Quiet surroundings, good service (sauna and fitness center as well). We did not try the breakfast as it was 13 euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and contemporary!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The location to City Center can get annoying but it is situated in a beautiful neighbourhood and the nights we spent there were very comfortable. the staff was very helpful and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good value choice. Convennient public transport connections, 20min to Termini. Nice area (Corso Trieste) with some eateries and shops. Rooms clean and simple. Gym small, only cardio equipment. Good service.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from city centre”
Reviews.Author: Hip_shake
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Rome right beginning July and we had chosen this hotel without knowing how far it could be from city centre.We paid more than 50 euros from Fiumicino Airport to this hotel that lies on a small secondary street in one of the Rome's neighbourhood. The lady from reception desk (I remembered she had a spanish name; Selena or something...) wasn't helpful nor friendly at all as we were beggers not tourists. Rooms we stayed in, were big enough and clean.Simply furbished, in a spartan way.The hall carpet was stained and looked dirty. Breakfast-simply italian style-not too much 'cause you get fat! :) The worst memory refers to that receptionist I mentioned before; we asked her how to get in the city centre and she shortly answered: "Take the bus!" Questions followed as "Is it far the bus station?", "Where can we get tickets?" etc. She answered again as she was barking: "yes, it's close", "you get tickets there" etc. True reality: Bus station is about 1 km away from the hotel.We were already tired and nervous till we found it. As for tickets, our luck was with an italian girl that knew English and guided us to a farther shop that sold us the bus tickets. Between city centre and the hotel there are at least 10 bus station, so it's a very long way. The second day, we caught the same receptionist selling tickets to some other tourists. We asked her to sell us as well and she said she has not but her colleague finally gave us some.Helpful and friendly, isn't it? Me, personally I wouldn't stay again in that hotel as it is too far from any attraction. A poor breakfast as well and awful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Super value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet location, 15 min. bus travel from center. Absolutely top breakfast, nice clean bathroom and room. Staff at reception very polite and helpful, special thanks for the great restaurant tip (San Marino). So I already recommended this hotel to friends and if we travel to other cities we will search for offers of Mercure hotels first. Very reasonable price. thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Flying Rome Visit”
Reviews.Author: freelancer2000 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situted in a quite area of Rome which is best accessed by taxi 25 Euro's for the train station. Do nt take the bus unless you have lots of time to waste. The hotel staff are friendly and helpful. The down side to this hotel is the beds are soft and lumpy. No kettle for making tea or coffee, but does have a fridge with two free bottles of water. Overall for the price not a bad hotel, has free wireless internet vouchers for 3 hrs per nights stay. which is usuable away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Homey”
Reviews.Author: Chic_chef81
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in Italy and Stefano (reservations) was very accommodating in answering our queries in a timely manner. The hotel is located in a quiet and lovely neighborhood of Corso Trieste, with superb restaurants nearby. We love San Marino's Pizzeria just few blocks away and Gianni's Pizza along Piazza Isteria. Though the main attractions are quite far, it was actually accessible as bus stations are a mere 5-7 minutes walk. Rooms are really clean and well-maintained. Only downside is that during our stay, the gym is under service. The staff are friendly and accommodating, I'll definitely go back! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in very quiet neibourhood”
Reviews.Author: Michelle1373
Reviews.Content: we stayed in Mercure Corso Trieste for two nights, in October. The hotel offer a good value for money. Five bus station to/from Termini (bus no 90) or 6 bus station to/from Piazza Venezia (bus no 60) so not more than 15-20 minutes to the center. The neibourhood is really quiet and elegant, a lot of villas and gardens around. There are also small restaurants and bars full of local people. We tried one on the corner of Nomentana street on the way to bus station and we had a great lunch - huge and very tasty pasta dishes for 5 Euros each. Billa Supermarket just 500 meters from the hotel, also the bus station. The rooms are spacious and clean. The cosmetics in bathroom were good quality and the towels were new and spotless, also the bed linen. There are two free bottles of water in minibar, replaced daily. The only problem (not so big due to the warm weather) was the air conditioning which was not functioning al all - no hot, no cold. Fortunately, we do not need it, even in the night was a bit cold. We had breakfast included and it was better than expected. A lot of choices from hot to cold dishes, good quality product and good coffee. I really reccommend this hotel for the price value, cleaning and location (if you have 15 minutes to spend in local bus).

Reviews.Title: “Improvement required”
Reviews.Author: 169Daniel169
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not excellent or even good. Location of the hotel was the biggest issue- too far from the city centre (20 min by bus to get to the subway). Reception not very helpful, the information they gave us was not sufficient, especially about the bus routes. Bar very quiet and dull, no entertainment at all. Gym and swimming pool was closed, no other option given.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Roma Corso Trieste”
Reviews.Author: Travellerofold Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late September 2011 after our original hotel in Piazza Bologna had messed up reservations. What a great hotel - our room had a balcony so it was great to sit outside and enjoy some wine after a hard day of sightseeing. It took a while to figure out the bus system into the centre but the neighbourhood had great restaurants - non touristy - and it was very quiet. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “3 star felt like a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Amesthyite
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 9 month old baby. We arrived very late at night because we thought it would be best to get there by train from the Airport. Mistake we did not make a second time. Hotel staff was nice and welcoming even at the late hour. They all spoke English with us and were very friendly. We were agreeably surprised by the size of the room. It was a corner room on the last floor (6) with a beautiful large terrace where there was a table and four chairs. There was a third bed in the room in a removed corner, where the baby cot fit just perfectly. After the first night we noticed it was right below an air vent so we moved her cot closer to our bed. The room, linen and bathroom were all very clean. We left a tip for the cleaning person and they did a rather good job. Reception staff was extremely helpful during our whole stay. We appreciated being able to ask anything and they would try their best to help us out. There are lots of buses near by, depending on where you want to go. For the train station you can catch some direct buses a bit further from the hotel, reducing your time to travel to the centre by half. Italian breakfast (6Eur) is really limited and not worth if if you want to actually EAT something. Buffet breakfast (15Eur) has OK choice though slightly over-priced as there is nothing made to order. One night we came back late and asked the person at the bar on the 7th floor for a cheese plate. Although we were after hours the person prepared one and brought it down to us. We did a lot of visiting and we noted that public transportation is always packed whatever time of day so take a lightweight stroller easy to fold up! The Roma pass is really worth it especially because you get to skip lines on the first two monuments you visit. For the Vatican museum there are tons of scams out there so would recommend reserving your ticket on-line on the official website up to 60 days before going there. It's a skip-the-line as well :-) Hotel location is quite removed from the centre but very calm and safe-feeling. There are some nice-looking restaurants nearby we however didn't get to test any. Overall a very good hotel, we recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Corso Trieste”
Reviews.Author: ChefAnnMt_Laurel_NJ
Reviews.Content: Wonderful neighborhood hotel with several neighborhood restaurants in the area. Very comfortable, very clean rooms. Service very good. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice suburb!”
Reviews.Author: piccaninny
Reviews.Content: We have stayed there for 3 nights, the hotel is located in a quiet and lovely suburb with a big supermarket nearby, we go there everyday to get fruit and breakfast. the hotel staff is friendly and knowleageble. Just need to be aware the taxi driver is very tricky in rome, we have got scammed for 50euro on the way to the hotel from termini. on the last day, we have ordered a taxi via hotel, only cost us 12Euro. Thus the location of the hotel is not in the central of rome but can be easily reached by metro, bus or tram. The room is reasonbly big and the bed is comfy, the value for money is good. Should go to check out the roof bar :)

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Mercure Roma Corso Trieste, October 2011”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a good area in Rom e just a little away from the hustle of the old city but on a very good bus route to the central city. The room was clean and well maintained and the staff were helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, average accomodation”
Reviews.Author: edhimal
Reviews.Content: Located in a nice, quiet neighborhood. Enough good restaurants within walking distance. By bus and tram good connections to all parts of the city. Friendly staff, nice roof terrace, nice wine list, with good wines by the glass at sharp prices. However, earlier this year we stayed in an Ibis Hotel (same hotel chain) in Bordeaux and we payed halve of what we payed here and we had a similar room and a better breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Rome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable hotel with very accomodating staff, about a 30 minute bus ride to central Rome. Breakfast offered a choic of Italian light breakfast of for a few euros more one could chose the full buffet breakfast, the choice was perfect:)

Reviews.Title: “Worth the money”
Reviews.Author: 1968Stefano
Reviews.Content: Well located in case you want to visit Rome and its historical beauties, both the room and the public spaces are clean, breakfast is ok and the hotel staff is very friendly and nice. The last day we left our suitcases till late aftyernoon and when leaving we even got complimentary water ;-) Exactly what I'm expecting when staying in a hotel belonging to an Internation chain.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay but we got what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: truckieandthewife
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms and helpful staff but you had to pick the right one. There are a few restaurants around and if you ask the staff they will point in the right direction. Breakfast was average and I would not have paid for it, if not included. Avoid the coffee and eggs at breakfast in fact avoid the breakfast and eat locally as they are very cheap and authentic. You can book tours and taxi from the reception plus buy bus tickets as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were in Europe for three weeks of which 3 days were spent in Rome. This hotel is under very good management. We stayed in NOVOTELS, IBIS'S, and MERCURES throughout our holiday and this hotel was easily the best. There are direct busses to the city centr and the central railway station. I suggest that the reception should keep bus tickets for sale to customers. Very important. We were lucky. The bus driver took us free for our first ride as he was not allowed to sell tickets or collect money. We then armed ouselves with enough tickets for our stay. Even the taxi from the centre to the hotel was not too expensive. The hotel is close to everything and yet it is in a very nice and quet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “2 day stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: As the Hotel was 5 klms from the City a more extensive menu for evening meals would have been welcome as there was not much choice locally. Another gripe is the computer usage, a 3 hour limit card is issued but some guests take advantage and it is hard to access time for use. I think a better system is a 20 minute time as in some hotels giving a better spread of usage. We found the staff mainly helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Roma”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Even thou the location of the hotel was well hidden from public view and difficult to find,it was in a nice, quiet and homey location! I can not say enough good things about the friendliness and helpful attitude of all the desk staff,in particular,Ms. Silvia and Ms. Luisa and the gentleman I forget the name that went beyond expectations to accomodate my wife and myself! They even made a call to our hotel in Paris to change and confirm our reservation date!They absolutely deserve a promotion and a rase! Job well done guys!! We will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: kisskissboomboom
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not very far from Roma Termini train station. Within 10 mins walk you have metro connection too. Also bus stops are near by. I was quite impressed by the stuff at reception. She helped us a lot regarding transport information. As a whole the hotel is very nice. I specially liked the bar- restaurant on the 7th floor. It has a rooftop view. Sipping wine with ur partner on this rooftop in the evening was quite romantic.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value relation”
Reviews.Author: robzrad
Reviews.Content: Gett good price to value relation - out friends in the same time had to pay 40 euro more for more or less the same standard. Room is clean, staff is nice, free bottles of water in the fridge is kind. Communication to city center ie ok - frequent buses or taxi (10 €).

Reviews.Title: “Good reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Tomas1983 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights. Hotel is situated quite far from city centre, about 15 minutes from the nearest metro station. Breakfast rich enough, we just missed fresh vegetables. Reception staff very friendly and helpfull. Receptionist Silvia helped us in every situation. There is a nice roof bar, we had few drinks there and the bartender was very friendly. They have a garage and they charge 20 euros per day for it, but you can leave your car on the street just next to hotel and it will cost you twice less, on the other hand your car is safe in their garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, but Location isn't at the city center”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Stephy
Reviews.Content: Mercure Roma Corso Trieste has a good quality of room, comfortable bed and spacious bathroom. Wi-Fi is offered for free for all guests. The hotel has a sauna, and roof-top bar, fitness centre and a sun-bathing area at the roof-top. Quite ok facilities for a 3 stars hotel. The hotel staffs are helpful in giving you informations about Rome and its touristic attractions. The location is located in a residential area and not in the city center of Rome, and it takes around 20 minutes from the hotel to Termini bus station by bus, where later on you can go anywhere throughout the city of Rome. Access to the hotel by bus no 310 from Termini Station, alight at Piazza Istriza. By walking 10 minutes from the hotel, you can find some trattoria, ristorante, snack bar and gelatteria. Overall, my stay in this hotel was quite nice, only the location is a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for us, but make sure this is right for you”
Reviews.Author: tgbrfv
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for us, since we just wanted to visit museums and common tourist destinations. It was 3 blocks from a bus stop, which connected directly to the train station, metro, as well as common tourist destinations such as the Vatican. Getting our luggage to and from the hotel via bus was easy. The hotel was in a quiet residential neighborhood, which was away from all the tourist and city noise and traffic. There were plenty of places to eat, with a grocery and (but not a laundry) also within walking distance. Free unlimited wi-fi, but you just had to ask. The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful. There was always a staff member available who spoke English well. It was a great value for the money, since it was half the price of the hotels in the downtown and other tourist areas. We prepaid via the internet, so it was a great value for the money. The only problem we had was discovering that some US-based credit cards did not work in Italy. We had to call the hotel from the USA to confirm this reservation. Have a back-up plan for paying if the first (or second) card did not work.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & nice, but not close to anything you would want to see in Rome”
Reviews.Author: lisaann1065
Reviews.Content: Friendly & helpful staff. Clean room. I liked the bathroom. Not close to any sights. Breakfast is good. Staff called and arranged for our taxi to the airport and that was helpful. They also sold the Roma Pass that we wanted to purchase, that saved us the trip to go out and purchase it. I do recommend the Roma Pass for tourists. Check it out online.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, bit far from main attractions”
Reviews.Author: katrinaj89
Reviews.Content: The room was as you expect from a Mercure hotel - nice size, good furnishings, clean. Pleased that there was a good sized bath and the shower was very good. The staff were always pleasant and helpful, both at reception and in the breakfast room (the ypung woman here was very polite and friendly, and the reception staff ensured we were aware of the public transport strike upon check out). Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, there were just a few things that could have been better. The breakfast buffet left a bit to be desired - we have had much better buffets at Ibis hotels in Europe. What was offered was nice, but it just wasn't good value for money. We found it a bit annoying to come back to the hotel after long, hot days seeing Rome to find that the aircon had been turned off, so would have to wait for a comfortable temperature. The location of the hotel isn't great - it is a nice, leafy and quiet area, however there aren't many shops or restaurants nearby and it was a 20 minute walk to Bologna metro station to then get into the city centre and to the main attractions. We don't mind walking, but we weren't all that comfortable with getting back to the hotel in the dark, walking 20 mins through unlit, quiet areas.

Reviews.Title: “Kinda hated it”
Reviews.Author: forpriyank
Reviews.Content: it's only for those looking for budget options.. not worth the drive up in the city.. no tea / coffee amenities in room .. loved the balcony on 5th floor.. hotel staff was nice but few more English speaking are always welcome ..paid hotel parking came in as a surprise with a decent price tag, I wasn't expecting so much for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Roma Corso Trieste”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in early July 2011 with my spouse. Pretty good hotel with cosy location in the central area and definetely worth its price. It took only 4 minutes walk to get to the bus stop and abt 15 minutes to get to the Center / TerminI / Pza Venezia. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: wakawa14
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel and enjoyed our stay. The hotel, fit not only our budget but offered a neighbourhood feeling in an otherwise busy city. The rooms, were well decorated and after staying in several other hotels in Italy were finally a size we are accustomed too. The staff were all very friendly and helpful, our only little quibble is related to them not having irons available in the rooms, and you have to request one each time you need it which can be a little irritating. A tip for other travellers, make sure your LAN port is working on your laptops, ours wasn't, and the staff were great in trying to assist us to figure out what's wrong... they charge a ridiculous fee for wireless. During our short stay the general computer in the lobby was down, but the staff were kind enough to allow me to check my work email on their computers. The staff recommended a near by restaurant that we wound up frequenting for all our nights in Rome. Also, once you figure out how to get there, the hotel is conveniently located along public transportation routes, to reduce your reliance on taxi's. We recommend this place, and have friends who will be going shortly, and whom we hope will have a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: “The management decides if you are thermally comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jfcarli
Reviews.Content: Wife and I were guests of Mercure Corso Trieste for a full week, from the 21st to the 28th of May 2011. We were in Rome for pleasure. In general, we would expect more from a three star hotel, specially when the desk prices of that hotel are 200 euros per couple/per night. Pros: Free internet, tea kettle in the room, a tub in the bathroom, and a reasonably decent and quiet neighborhood. Cons: Dirty walls, poor decor, small and cramped room, no in-room safe, and (worst of all) the air conditioning was not available for 14 hours each day from 20:00 to 10:00 the following morning. Basically, it was only available during the day hours when guests were out of the hotel. It was available each day, for a ten hours period, from 10:00 to 20:00. Once you got back to the hotel, at night, you found the air-conditioning had been turned off by the management. This went on the full week we were there. By the way, this was a particularly warm week, in late May. Basically, it is the management that decides about the guest's thermal comfort or discomfort. If I am not mistaken, in other hotels, it is usually a thermostat that says whether the temperature is comfortable or not. But, this is not the case in the Mercure Corso Trieste. When we complained about the lack of air-conditioning, the management simply ignored our complaints, and kept on repeating as if it were a mantra, that the air conditioning was only available from 10:00 to 20:00. Period! And that was it! That was the hotel policy and no one cared if the guests were thermally uncomfortable. Nothing could be done about that. Upon much insistance, the management informed us that, if we felt uncomfortable, we should open the windows!!! In this case we were subjected to the noise outside!!! Thank goodness in the wee hours the temperature became somewhat more comfortable. Frankly speaking, I would expect a different treatment from a Mercure Hotel, specially when you consider the price paid and the supposed star level.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Stm_eternity
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood away from Rome city centre. Require a bus ride to get to the center where the attractions are, only 15 mins. The bus stop is only a few blocks from the hotel. It's not inconvenient at all if you dont mind a short bus ride, there's a bus every 10 mins or so, never a long wait. I like the fact that it's in a neighborhood where u can truly experience the local. Hotel room is very clean and I'm a clean freak, totally loved the clean laminated floor and clean bathroom, bed. There are shops and restaurants only a few blocks away. I highly recommend San Marino - Great pasta!! Also good gelato nearby Theres a supermarket in the same area but extremely hard to find. It's located inside some clothing store called billa - how would I know a supermarket would be inside a clothing store?! That's kinda stupid. Anyways, the hotel staff r super friendly, but they don't give very clear directions, perhaps an Italian thing? One person told me one thing, the other person told me a complete opposite direction, but end up the same destination. I wish they had a better map. No coin laundry nearby, but hotel has laundry service like any others. They have free Internet if u have a cable to plug your computer in but no wifi. Overall, I enjoyed stating there.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel with great staff”
Reviews.Author: jetlag83
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in the hotel in Rome, and we really liked it,. Location: The hotel can be easily reached by (express) busses from different main locations in Rome (Termini, Piazza Spagnia, ...). No need to take a taxi (except when there is a strike on public transport). Short walk (approx 250m - 750m), depending on where you get of the bus. In the surroundings of the hotel there are lots of various restaurants and bars, tobacco stores and a BILLA supermarket (a little hidden). Staff: Very friendly, very helpful, speaking a lot of languages (at least Italian, German, French, English, Spanish). If you need advice, e.g. where to have lunch - go ahead and ask. Room: The room was (especially compared to what i have heard about rome) very spacious (lots of space around the bed), with everything you need (large bathroom, large bed, safe, flat-screen-TV, fridge, desk, lounge chairs, ...). Very comfortable. Breakfast: The breakfast (we had full breakfast as part of our offer) is very good, offering an more than average selection to choose from (usually bread, toast, cookies, joghurt, fresh fruit, cheese, fruit juice, cereals, eggs, bacon, sausages) as well as a nice suprice, the complimentary "smoothie of the day" Other amenities: The hotel offers small dishes from the bar, but has no restaurant itself, which does not matter as there are plenty around. The hotel bar itself has not too much to offer, still the wines are good an reasonably priced. Internet is available on additional charge if desired. We did not test other services, such as the laundry service.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable place to stay in rome in a quiet locality”
Reviews.Author: ashitpatel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just on the outskirts of central rome and it is just 10 minutes by bus to roma termini rail station.The hotel room was comfortable with basic amenities . The TV programmes have very limited English programmes so you are left with BBC and CNN to watch any time you want to watch Tv.There is no coffee/tea making machine in the room so for your morning coffee you have to get ready and go down to have your bed tea or coffee. The hotel serves a standard european buffet breakfast with fresh fruit cut and juices . We stayed there for 4 days and realised there was no change in the menu.The point to note is that the hotel does not serve any other meal other than breakfast.For meals the staff recommended Papa Verde restaurant very close to the hotel which served good value for money meals . The staff at the front front desk was very helpful and guided us for moving around rome also.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff saved what would have been a disaster of a trip!”
Reviews.Author: UkMon
Reviews.Content: Completely my fault - I had booked over the internet on 'no cancellation, no refund or amendment' deal' which was extremely reasonable for Rome. Unfortunately I made a mistake when booking and booked for the wrong month! The hotel reception staff were amazing, there wasn't even any insinuation made about my own stupidity. They were totally reassuring - they were fully booked the next night but went out of their way to reassure us that if they couldn't find anywhere at their hotel they would book is in a nearby hotel. They told us to go and enjoy the day in Rome, and would phone us later to let us know and they did and managed to find us space and even to stay in the same room - and they didn't charge us any extra - I was amazed. I am not sure chain hotels in the UK would ever be like this. It was also lovely and clean, and in a quiet location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - not central but easy to get to centre”
Reviews.Author: mann_man
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not in central Rome, it is only about 10 minutes by cab or bus. It was worth it as a hotel of similar quality in central Rome would have cost a fortune. The rooms were clean and smart, the breakfast was great (scrambled eggs, bacon, etc. plus a "German" type spread of meat and cheese as well as cereal, etc. The staff were very kind and friendly. There is not much in the surrounding area but as mentioned above, it's not too difficult or expensive to get into town as you could go by cab or catch a bus that is a 5-minute walk from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on Quiet Street”
Reviews.Author: Poohlicous
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a quiet surburan street, walking distance to bus transportation. The Hotel staff were friendly and helpful, and the room was modern and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Stale Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pavel1984
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel on Rome outskirts, very quiet and casual area. We used this hotel only for sleeping. Cash payment ONLY: they charged our card twice because didn't use authorization code. Didn't prolong check out time at least for one hour. Nice cafeteria for breakfast close to hotel: Bar Ben.AL - via Tolmino/via Bolzano. Very good closest pizzeria: San Marino on via San Marino.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Time”
Reviews.Author: CMAlbrecht
Reviews.Content: The sweet train ticket agent in Paris offered to book a room for us in Rome, so we had no idea of what to expect. We were very pleased with the hotel, the room itself, and with the staff. Rather than spend big euros for breakfast (being light eaters anyway), we opted for a little standup stall by the bus stop on Nomantea (?). Fresh rolls, freshly squeezed oraange juice and great coffee. Then the cashier sold us our bus tickets each day getting us off to a great start. We would definitely stay there again. (Aside: beware of the subway. Got my pocket picked on the train.. Also beware of some of the restaurants around tourist spots like the Vatican. Despite what the menu said, we got hit for 78 euros for two so-so spaghetti dinners and not being very adept in Italian all I could do was call the nice little old lady a ladra.)

Reviews.Title: “Very Good!”
Reviews.Author: GilzaF
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in october 2008 with my coworkers. This hotel has a good location and good prices, near the good restaurants. The location is nice and quiet. The rooms are comfortable and roomy. The staff are helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice place to stay with family. Hotel provides all what you want and no extra frills.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the "real" Roma”
Reviews.Author: giannicalvo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there Easter April 2009,Caught bus @ Stazione Termini,15 minute ride .The buses back to Termini were 5 minutes down the hill from hotel.Staff exceptionally helpful in ALL ways.They even made contact with my relatives in Tivoli for me. No language problems. Meals @ bar were good. Great neighborhood,quiet and NO tourist feel at all.Down the hill to the left & another left is a department store with the latest fashions & SUPERMARKET.We loaded up our refrigerator with great foods.Buses run often to Roma center and there is great fast food w/ local pizza(Pollo D'oro). All in all, I will never go back to tourist trap hotels..I really like this place!

Reviews.Title: “Nice week in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: While you do have to take a bus to reach the subway system, they are plenty and often. The location is nice and quiet. Restaurants are available within walking distance. The staff are helpful and friendly. If you are taking the train from FCO - go to Tramontina station and take a taxi from there. Rooms are comfortable but a coffee maker in room would be nicer. Some rooms do face the late garbage pickup which is very loud in the middle of the night. Morning breakfast is nice and at a budget price for what they offer (14euros pp). I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Balcony”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: During rain, the water from the roof fell on the balcony which made it hard to use and damaged the paint.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay, but you need to have a good sense of direction”
Reviews.Author: ikelmay
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights prior to a cruise departing from Civitavecchia. We couldn't have asked for better late October weather, and despite appalling jetlag enjoyed our stay here and our visit to Rome. We came in via Tiburtina station rather than Termini, then caught a cab to the hotel. Checkin was straightforward, the hotel was clean and compact, the rooms basic but certainly clean and tidy. The hotel is in a suburban location, but this is a huge positive in that it is quiet and very pleasant. If you are using public transport, make sure you have a map and a sense of which direction you approach the hotel from. We got tangled up a couple of times. As far as transport goes, get either a 1E ticket or the day pass for all public transport. There are plenty of bus routes that cover the main thoroughfares - we found the express 90 from Nomentura the easiest and quickest. It's a 10 minute walk and great to experience Rome through the eyes of the locals (where else would you find busking violinists on the buses?). We will certainly consider this hotel the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Final Invoice”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: On reciept of final invoice (brown printed copy) another guests details were printed on the reverse. It appears that his room was cheaper for the same stay as mine, even though I apparenty had a 'special' deal for the two nights. My rate was 250 euro and his was 90.

Reviews.Title: “Good place if you don't mind walking a bit.”
Reviews.Author: Mosespa
Reviews.Content: First of all, this hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. If this is not a problem for you, then it's a really good place. Moreover, as you're "far" from everything, the area is really quiet The crew (most of them speak good english & pretty good french) is really nice & hellpul . They called the Villa Borghese to book for us, gave us extra quilts, etc ... and they were always smiling & fast. The room we had was really dark (my friends had a bright one) and it's probably the only bad point, with the dry air of the room (but you have free bottles of water -still & sparkling- in the fridge) and the expensive wi-fi access. The bathroom is not huge but big enough and beds are comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice & clean hotel not faraway from town center.”
Reviews.Author: CosminG Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty comfortable and is situated in a very quiet area of Rome. Good breakfast & very friendly staff. The hotel offers free bottled water in every room. There's a very nice restaurant (Pepe Verde) some 3 minutes in walking distance from the hotel. Best way to reach the center of Rome is to take the bus from Istria Square.

Reviews.Title: “4 days in rome”
Reviews.Author: SUNYANHUANIEWNIEW Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The concierge service is totally useless, no decent plans available, no indications on buses or metro, or booking visits! they always calling their taxis with a fixed price, reserving 10€ for them ! no free internet 15 € per day !!! Breakfast very very average, Obliged to ask for fresh sheets. Safe system inaccurate. Very expensive, average location, no service

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, surely I choose it once again next time”
Reviews.Author: Adrian082
Reviews.Content: I was simply amazed by the clean room I had, it was very comfortable too. The hotel is just a 2 min walk from the bus stop, then you catch the bus number 310 and you stop at Piazza Bologna (5 min with the bus/20min by walk)....then you catch the metro to Termini (main station). It's just simple!! Hotel staff is ok, even better if you (like me) talk influent Italian :) I will choose it for sure the next time I'm going to Rome (very soon)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel...great staff”
Reviews.Author: Rasputin17 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel had fine accommodations and a helpful desk staff. Room was clean, breakfast was great, and Simmone at the front desk turned us on to an outstanding Green Line day tour that really showed us the city of Rome. Will stay here again when I go back!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay with a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: PeNor Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about 15 minutes walk from the Metro station but is in a quiet part of the city. The room walls are very thin and hence spoilt this quietness - the water pipes especially are old. The breakfast is too expensive for what is offered and the "free minibar" that was part of my room package was only 4 bottles of cool water!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good value for money but 20 min walk from the metro station”
Reviews.Author: katt1906 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiance stayed here at the end of September...the weather was about 22-25oC so I don't know what they would be like in the peak of summer but the rooms were perfect in that weather. The nearest metro stop is 20 mins away, although there are buses closer. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are quite and the staff are very helpful. The breakfast is basic and the bread was stale from being left out but for the price it was a good addition. If you don't mind the walk then I would recommen this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MiguelMen
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Rome was wonderful. The city is spectacular, people are friendly and food is great (not very expensive). We arrive at the Fiumicino airport and were convinced by a nice gentleman to go on his Van (something like a taxi but with 8 sets) and coasted 20€ each person. On our way back, we have paid 65 € in a taxi from the hotel to the airport. Our room (414) at the Mercure was very comfortable and quite. The people at the hotel were efficient but, in our opinion, with a lack of smile. One night we needed a blanket and the answer was, “come down to pick it up, because I’m alone at the front desk….”. We didn’t have any meal at the hotel. For breakfast we found one of the various place near the hotel were we had our morning coffee and sandwich for around 5€ each. To go to downtown, we bought a 3 day pass (all public transportation included) for 11€ and it was very easy to go by bus or by train from the hotel to downtown. If you stay there ask at the hotel the bus number, but make sure that they explain exactly were to catch it, because there many options, some near others far from the hotel. We end using subway (Bologna) and bus. You have to add a 10 minute walk on the top. For the meals, we had lunch in the city center and dinner on restaurants near the hotel, we recommend the Pizzeria San Marino (the one that stays on the main street) and the restaurant in front of this place. But again, we didn’t have a bad meal on our 5 days stay. We recommend the hotel and the city and we will go back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a quiet area”
Reviews.Author: KatJon10
Reviews.Content: A nice and clean hotel, we liked it. Upon arrival they didn't find our reservation, but after re-checking they had just spelled our name wrongly. The hotel room was very roomy and well cleaned. There was no min bar in the room but the fridge was refilled with free mineral water every day, especially nice as it was rather hot during our stay. The staff was friendly and almost everyone was fluent in English. However, the restaurant was more like a bar, we went there for dinner one evening and got microwave-cooked pasta. Still, the wine that we had along with the pasta was excellent and compensated for the food.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel, with nonchalant hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: SiennaSingapore Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: It is just a hotel, with little or no hospitabilty.

Reviews.Title: “No Frills Hotel in a Nice Neighbourhood!”
Reviews.Author: UKonthego
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights and was pleased with the hotel. My room was clean but basic - fine for a short stay. The complimentary water was a nice touch! The front desk agents were most friendly. Although the hotel is rather basic and functional, the neighbourhood that it is in is great and there are many restaurants and cafes quite close to the hotel. The hotel is a bus or cab ride from the historical area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best in terms of Service”
Reviews.Author: freetraveller82
Reviews.Content: I was wanting to make a choice between Mercure Colosseum and this one. Quite dissapointed after the stay as we did not get the room what was promised to us, inspite of being an Accor Favorite Guest. Will definitely not stay here next time.

Reviews.Title: “nice chain hotel, location a bit far.....”
Reviews.Author: chicocussiano
Reviews.Content: this hotel is everything you could expect from a chain hotel, the only perhaps is its location..... far away from all major atractions and the nearest tube station. Besides that it is good value for money... last remark is that breakfeaat is way to expensive for what you get in return and for what you can eat in other places in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LuViPortland
Reviews.Content: This property is all good. There are two internet options, and one is excellent and nearly free. They run into problems during the breakfast buffet because they have placed style above practicality. So when everybody wants food at once, and there is a crowd, there is a traffic jam at the breakfast bar. It was also unusual to keep the fitness center closed until 10:00 a.m. Perhaps it's above a guest room. We've been on the road for days, and this is the best place we've found. Other hotels should copy their staff and guest facilities.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL IN A NICE RESIDENCIAL AREA”
Reviews.Author: ettyus
Reviews.Content: Excelent area, excelent rooms, staff and food ok. A litlle bit far from public transportation but surrounding area is very quiet. a nice place to sleep if you whant to visit Roma

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Hotel at Corso Trieste”
Reviews.Author: dfghj89-xing
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Roma Corso Trieste is newly renovated Mercure hotel in the northern part of Rome. Accessible via autobus 36, 90, 84 from Stationi Termini. The rooms are equipped with flat screen TV, safe, fridge and balcony. Unfortunately chairs and a table is missing on the balcony. The concierge is very helpful in case problems occur and recommended us phantastic places to go. The breakfast is a standard middle class breakfast, however the bread offered was slightly old.

Reviews.Title: “AVERAGE HOTEL, FAR FROM MAJOR ATTRACTIONS AND DIFFICULT TO REACH”
Reviews.Author: andr123
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from a 30 days trip to Italy. I have chosen this hotel because it was below the average price for Rome. But I really regret that decision as we spent a lot of money with transportation ( lots of taxi rides in order to avoid loosing a lot of time on packed buses and subway dirty trains , it costs an average of 30 euros a day). I was traveling with my mother who is 75 yo. Rome is not easy to get around as it`s bigger than the other major cities and the sights are spread thought the city. There is a lot of hills and you can get quite tired only by walking on the sights, so it`s better not to waist your energy and precious time on the way to get there....

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but little hard to find if alone”
Reviews.Author: relloggrion
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in one of the best residential area of Rome city. Teh hotel lies 100 meters from a main street and therefore there are no noises during teh day or teh night. But because it is not on a main street you mai get lost if you try to get there for teh first time. I would therefore suggest to take a taxi. The hotel is clean and confortable. I get a big 30 square meter rooms (but paid full price). Generally teh hotel is fully booked and you have to book in advance. Good for business travellers who do not want to sleep in the suburb but want to sleap close to a main street getting out of the city in short time. For tourist you have to take busses (quite difficult to get on at morning before 10 am as many peopla use busses to go to work/school) out of rush hours your bus will be easy to catch and use. With teh bus you have to count 25 minutes to reach Termini train station . Direct bus for the "fori imperiali" takes 35 minutes

Reviews.Title: “Good money value, Great service”
Reviews.Author: mi_coelho
Reviews.Content: I was in Mercure Corso Trieste for 4 days in Rome. The hotel is not city centered, however you have a large number of buses departing from Corso Nomentana and Piazza Istria, both 5 min walk from the hotel, that take you easily to the city center or aeroport. All the buses are available till late at night so you can stay in center untill late. The hotel is situated in a residential area, very safe, so we had no problems reaching the hotel late at night. The hotel has very good rooms, spacious, clean and they offer you the water in the room. You have 3 types of breakfast that vary from 6 euros - it was the one we took, it has capuccino, juice and croissants, so it is not too expensive- to 13 euros where you can eat everything, however if you choose not to eat there you have very good coffee shops nearby. For dinner there is a great restaurant at Piazza Istria called San Marino. It is cheap and it has great food, we dinned there 3 times out of 4. The staff is very helpfull and nice. If it wansn't for them I would know what busses to take each time I want to go somewhere. They also sell bus tickets in the reception, so better of us turists. Definitly a hotel to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly, affordable and clean”
Reviews.Author: joynz_10
Reviews.Content: I totally lost my bearings on arriving at this hotel close to midnight. It sits closely packed amidst equally high rise residential buildings connected by very narrow roads. The young gent at reception was very polite and helpful and the reception area itself was well lit and welcoming. The hotel is clean and room 419 has a view overlooking the street but no balcony and minimal street level noise. It was spacious with room enough for luggage. Shower over the bath, toilet and boudeau behind the door. There are no tea/coffee making facilities nor microwave but there's a mini bar. The outdoor solarium is located on the roof (same floor as the indoor gym) and here you can sit and enjoy the peace and quiet while overlooking the neighbours roof tops (you can smoke here too). There is a basic continental and cooked breakfast on offer but no restaurant. We could find no convenience stores in the immediate area but we found a couple of small restaurants/takeaways about a 10 minute walk away. My favourite time for walking is at night but I did not feel safe venturing beyond the well lit range of the hotel steps by myself. We chose this hotel because of the reviews it received through trip advisor, and the rate was good, but in retrospect and knowing my preference for night walking, we should have chose a hotel much closer to the iconic sites such as the Colloseum and the Vatican. The bus stop was just at the end of the hotel street (5 min walk) and eight or nine bus stops later we were at the main terminal, the Stazzioni. Here you could jump on any number of the Hop On, Hop Off Bus Tours in the area. Purchasing a ticket direct from the bus is cheaper than from the hotel, this hotel anyway, or via the internet from NZ. If you cannot avoid sightseeing during the weekends go early, the crowds and queues by midday are horrendous.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Experience, All Great!!”
Reviews.Author: diesssel
Reviews.Content: The staff was sooo polite, and all of them were speaking English! The neighbourhood was very safe. Only a 3 minute walk to the buses 36 & 84. Then a short bus ride (less than 10 minutes) to central Termini station. Very easy and convenient transportation. The breakfast was really good! Great variety. The rooms very very clean! Free bottles of water everyday in the minibar! 4 of them!! There was a safe in the room. and free internet (wired). The room very spacious! The price was almost half of the money we would pay for a similar more central hotel. Definitely highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: DavyAlt
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel was clean and quite modern and the staff were pleasant and helpful. Our room even had a balcony which would be nice in the summer. The check-in was a bit long winded but there was 15 of us and they wanted everyones passport details. There is a small bar area in the hotel lobby which closes at midnight but we never used it. This hotel is a good base for your City Break in a quiet suburb. Although not located in the tourist area it is only a short bus ride to Termini Station where you have full access to Trains, Buses and Metro System. The buses are very frequent so you never have to wait long. They run from 6.30am 'til midnight. To get to the hotel we found the quickest was to take the 90 Express bus from Termini and get off at 'Via Nomentana (Villa Torlonia)'. From there it is only a 10 minute walk to the hotel. Alternatively you can get the 310 bus and get of at 'Santa Costanza' (there are 3 stops on this road so you need to take the 2nd one). From there again it is only a short walk away. There are other buses you can catch, you just need to check the bus stops to see whiich ones go to Termini. We didn't eat at the hotel but found a nice local cafe in the Piazza Istria at the bottom of 'Via Bisagno' only a short walk from the hotel. There you can get coffees, fresh pastries and toasted sandwiches. An great start to the day!

Reviews.Title: “Worth the commute although internet expensive!”
Reviews.Author: beech_bunnie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bus ride away from Termini (the main train station) and a metro ride away from the historical city center; the whole process took an average of 30 minutes to/from the area. The rooms were clean and spacious and the free minibar consisted of 4 bottled waters. The front desk staff spoke English and were helpful. The residential neighborhood felt safe and quiet. The nearby restaurant "La Belle Epoque" provided terrible service and the food mediocre yet overpriced. However the hotel did not have a complimentary business center and to use the computer in the lobby was at 50 cents/minute which requires a credit card that pre-authorizes at $70 each use without prior warning. Overall, a good place to stay if you don't mind not being close to the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “3 nights in Roma”
Reviews.Author: aussie_traveler_7
Reviews.Content: Rome is a fascinating place, so much to see and do. Our stay at the Mercure was ok. The hotel is about 5 ks form the city. We walked the 1.5 kilometers to the subway. This is a great way of getting around. 1 euro per ride. The room was average, the beds average. this is not a bad hotel, its just hard to find anything exciting about it, ecxept the cheap rate we paid. We knew it was a distance from the city, but the subway made the travelling easy. the breakfast was adequate, just. Yes i would stay again as the hotel is in a very quiet area, and the subway is not far away. Plus it is a lot cheaper than hotel in Rome itself. Parking was easy and the cost was 20 euro per night

Reviews.Title: “Location might be an issue”
Reviews.Author: Cigarfreak
Reviews.Content: Location is far away from the heart of Rome. You need a good bus ride of 15-20 minutes to get to Piazza Venezia and from there a good deal of walking. If you want to stay late in town you will either take the night bus N4 or be prepared for a cab ride of 10-15€. Not all taxi drivers know the location. You find a similar priced room situated better than this one. I did enjoy the commute so it was no biggy for me. Plus, the residential area is nice. A few nice places to eat around the hotel or within a 15-20minutes walk. Staff is not very friendly. Rooms are below average. On Sunday morning there was hard core house keeping activities right outside the room at around 9AM.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Be Back”
Reviews.Author: WeeTooner
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel so thought I knew what I was getting and this turned out to be the case.. The hotel is a bit far out but after walking to the metro about 20 minutes away, it is only a 5 minute ride to Termini where you can pick up buses, trams and tour buses. On the other hand turn right out of the hotel and 5 minutes takes you to a bus route with buses going to Termini. The hotel was spotlessly clean, our room was excellent and had a balcony which we had not expected. The room was completely soundproofed so we had the best night's sleep we had had in years. The staff were so helpful and couldn't do enough for us. There are several bars and restaurants in the vicinity, though a bit difficult to find, but we just asked at reception and they kept us right. It was our first trip to Rome and I was pleased I had pre-booked transport direct from the airport as the hotel would be difficult to find if you didn't know your way about. Our transfer was £72 return which we thought was OK and worth the bit extra. I will certainly return to Rome and would have no hesitation in using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: sweet_mermaid
Reviews.Content: Value for money and walking distance to a subway. Location is in a residential neigbourhood, quiet and a few eateries nearby. Hotel services are fine but not overly helpful or friendly. No free internet access.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in very quiet area”
Reviews.Author: Andy_1950
Reviews.Content: The Mercure Corso Trieste is for me an ideal Rome hotel. The price fluctuates depending on demand but is usually very competitive. It is just outside the centre but only a few stops on a fast bus or 10-15€ by taxi. The hotel is very clean with a smart bar serving snacks and has a buffet breakfast room in the basement but if you are in a hurry use one of the man bars nearby for an authentic Italian breakfast. The bedrooms are standard Mercure with all that you need - safe box, bath not just shower (good to soak after a long day in the city), spotless clean linen. The street on which the hotel stands has almost no through traffic and is very quiet despite being close to many restaurants and good shopping streets. Try it - you wont be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Not the right hotel if you prefer to be closer to the sights.”
Reviews.Author: tntonthego01
Reviews.Content: When I booked this hotel, I read reviews saying that it was a bit far from the center. I need to clarify that it IS far from the center, and not just a bit. I admit, I should've checked the map before booking. My husband and I can walk long distances (and truth be said, the walk to the nearest metro is not even that long) but having a 21 month old baby with you just makes it challenging. Especially when you consider the lack of escalators/lifts at the metro stations to accommodate commuters with strollers. Bottomline: If you enjoy the luxury of going back to your hotel mid-day to relax or freshen up before hitting the sights again, this is not the right hotel for you. On the other hand, if you like to stay in a hotel away from tourists, then this could work for you.The rooms are not that spacious but clean. I always like it when they have a mini-bar fridge. Basic necessities are provided except for lotion. I forgot mine and was a bit annoyed that they didn't have any. Breakfast wasn't exciting and the hotel lobby looks bare and lacks that cozy feeling.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel, but far from city center”
Reviews.Author: LeaAthens
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was very good, although high priced. The drawback was that it took about 25 minutes to get to city center because we had to walk 15 minutes to the metro, then take the metro a few stops to the center. Also, for the price charge, I expected a better breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing”
Reviews.Author: northisland
Reviews.Content: I had read all of the reviews I could find on the hotel before we traveled, so I had a little concern when we checked in. As soon as we got there the concern disappeared. The hotel is most pleasant, clean and located in a very quiet neighborhood. The staff was most helpful. Once you understand the bus and metro system getting to and from anywhere in Rome or the surrounding areas is a cinch. (you can familiarise yourself on line) Bed was really comfortable, bathroom large, hotel quiet. One tip, before we flew in we hired a car through Roma Shuttle, Driver met us loaded the bags, and delivered two tired campers for 40 euro, The also take credit cards in the car. One other important tip, use ATM machines rather than currency converters, that is unless you like throwing money away. There was a slight fee from my bank, but nothing like the money changers..

Reviews.Title: “pretty good”
Reviews.Author: fubarANDY
Reviews.Content: we were satisfied.. best to take bus service to Bologna Metro..bus numbers 109 or 93... a tobacco shop near to sell you 3-day passes whcih covers the metro and buses..

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for money”
Reviews.Author: KarishmaNetherlands
Reviews.Content: Hii There, We have just returned from an exciting trip to Italy and we stayed at this hotel for 2 days. The hotel is situated in an area directly accessible by public transport and is very near to the tourist attractions like the Colosseum and the like. The hotel is excellent value for money, the rooms are spacious, nice and clean with all the necessities and luxuries like bath tubs etc. You get complimentary tea, coffee etc in the mornings and the place is very serene and calm. It is likely a perfect haven when you return at night from all the sight seeing. The staff is friendly and the overall ambience is nice and pleasant. We paid 85 euros per night and it was by far the best hotel we have stayed on our trips in Europe. Me and my husband really enjoyed staying in the hotel and will recommend it to one and all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - just a bit far out”
Reviews.Author: srh10
Reviews.Content: Would definitely reccommend, great business style hotel but with super roof terrace and outdoor area. Only issue was it wasn't walking distance to main sights but taxis very cheap, especially if you are travelling with a group as we were. Fantastic local restaurants just nearby, including our best Italian meal ever.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...”
Reviews.Author: noweef
Reviews.Content: I selected this hotel because its location is off the beaten-track of Rome's city center. To an extent this turned out great because the hotel's neighborhood is relatively quiet and not swamped with tourists. I enjoyed the regular supermarket around the corner, the produce market on Saturday and the Mediterranean feel of this neighborhood. However...what you miss is exploring Rome at night. Rome is a crowded, noisy city packed with tourists and traffic. It would've been great to return to my room at the end of the day, freshen-up and return to the, now empty, streets of downtown Rome to (re)visit some sights. The room was spacious and clean, beds good, nice bathroom with bidet and shower/bath. What was NOT GOOD was the internet connection. The hotel offers WiFi internet provided by Vodafone. I found this system unreliable and way too expensive. Often hotels offer internet access in the lobby for free and in the room for a fee. But not here. Using one's laptop in the lobby was equally expensive as in the room. I was very annoyed by the lack of free/unlimited intenet use. Breakfast downstairs is very basic. And it's too bad there is no water boiler in the room especially since the downstairs lobby is not very cozy. And for anyone who wants to make use of the (free) bicycle...make sure you have some experience. Rome traffic is brutal and the hotel-bikes are not city-bikes but rather mountain-bikes. Make sure to get a good public transportation map at Termini as not just bus 84 but also other (express) buses stop close to the hotel. Information provided by the front desk is limited. Not a bad hotel and not a great hotel. Make a decision according to your priorities... EdW, Amsterdam, The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for short stay in Roma”
Reviews.Author: MikeAndMarj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Mecure Roma for 3 nights in June. Bruno, who welcomed us at the front desk said, "What language you speak? We can handle Chinese, Japanese, German and English." Although we were eager to begin speaking in our newly-studied Italian language, it was comforting to know that English was not only understood, but spoken very well. Bruno was of great assistance on arrival and throughout our short stay. The room was very nice, well appointed, spotless and well furnished with heavy curtains. On our arrrival at Roma Aeroporto, we were offered a ride to the hotel for Euros 102. Upon our horrified look, we were then offered the ride for Euros 80. However, we opted for a shared van for Euros 50, but had to wait until the driver had a full van. It suited us just fine as we weren't in a hurry, we met some lovely tourists and had an excellent tour of the city as we were the last passengers to be dropped off at the hotel. We did not have breakfast at the hotel, but we found a little bar that served panini and coffee which we were able to enjoy sitting at the sidewalk tables observing the comings and goings of the locals - partaking in (perhaps) their first shot of coffee for the day or their last puff of a cigarette before starting work. Unfortunately for us, our second day in Roma was spoilt by the visit by American President, George W. Bush. The city literally came to a halt with all levels of police, some with anti-riot gear, on hand. For dinner, we patronised the Pepi Verdi Restaurant for good food and good value, and it was a short walk from the hotel. From previous reviews, we did understand that this hotel was a little out of the way and, once used to the transport system, it wasn't too difficult. Providing you bear this in mind, we certainly would recommend this hotel for a Roma holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Civilised hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterSparky
Reviews.Content: Clean and comfortable hotel, friendly staff, room was lovely, especially liked the bathroom, and the firm bed. Only small downside was the location, but it was a lovely, if long walk into the centre of Rome, along orange-tree lined streets. However, the buses left from five minutes away, at Via Nomentana, and you could get tickets at the shops on the way. Try the breakfast in bed option, it's a lovely start to the day, with fruit, yoghurt, coffee and pastries, etc. Just one down side was that the bar seemed a little expensive.. Not to be missed is the Pepe Verde restaurant, around the corner from the hotel, recommended by the receptionist, it had wood-fired pizza oven, and was used by all the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice, Well, More or Less...”
Reviews.Author: Pepetito
Reviews.Content: Mercure Corso Trieste is definitely an option - standards are very good, room is not small, hotel - relatively new. If the rates are OK with you, this entity could be considered. Breakfast (EUR 13 p/person) is not normally included in their rates, however it worth the money - abundant & widest choice of high quality food. But please be informed on shortcomings: a) don't forget your earplugs as starting 5AM in the morning some deliveries or nearby people gather around the hotel on their noisy cars speaking loudly, so you wake up; b) nearest metro station Piazza Bologna is ~15min by feet and the part of Rome where this hotal is situated is definitely not central part ; c) on their website it's said they provide free of charge bicycles - in reality those bikes are all "reserved" or lady-type.

Reviews.Title: “Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinguy35
Reviews.Content: Clean modern hotel, bit out of the way. Staff were dreadful - plenty of them but very slow and unhelpful. One insisted on checking in 2 other sets of guests before calling a taxi which was required urgently. Bar man took over 10 minutes to pour 4 beers - no other customers in bar. Took about 40 minutes standing at desk to extend stay by a couple of nights!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgatsby
Reviews.Content: We stayed for six nights at this hotel and really enjoyed our stay. It is a way out of the centre in a quiet neighbourhood but the bus on Via Nomentana is only a short walk away and the 84 takes you to Piazza Venezia, walk down the road a little and take the 62 right to the front of St Peters (get tickets at the tobacconist on Corso Trieste). Checkin was swift and efficient and our room was on a corner with a large terrace overlooking a small church. The room was more than adequate with a modern bathroom and every night was quiet and undisturbed by noise outside or inside the hotel. Breakfast was good with the continental option much better than the cooked. There was no waiting for tables, everything was very efficient. The area around the hotel has some good places to eat. We tried four different ones - Pepe Verde on Viale Gorizia was a good budget choice, Belle Epoque on Via Ajaccio was excellent. Glicine e la Margherita on Corso Trieste is a little pricier with a varied menu but the real splurge was Da Ezio le Scalette on Via Chiana a seafood restaurant with most of the menu swimming in tanks, a great atmosphere and service. There is a bar in the hotel which provides snacks. There are plenty of shops around including a supermarket. Quite close to the hotel is the church of San Agnese (Via De San Agnese) which has great catacombs as well as most of the remains of St Agnes. We would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: StephaneJohn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my boyfriend for a celebration weekend. The hotel was located about a 10-15 minute walk from the subway, or about 3 minutes from the bus. Transportation was quick, affordable, safe, and efficient. We arrived at the hotel around 1230pm, and were able to check in early. Our room was spacious, and being on the corner we had a huge, beautiful balcony overlooking a church. The hotel was very quiet, and the room was perfectly clean and nice. The bathroom was modern and spacious, even if the hot water ran out after about 10 minutes. Breakfast was included, and very filling and high quality. There were many choices and everything was good. We definitely recommend this hotel for the quality in relation to the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A cool retreat from the heat and chaos”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here on business. My usual hotel (the Mercure Piazza Bologna) down the road was full, so opted for the Corso Trieste instead. Due to an incoming flight delay I didn't reach the hotel until after midnight. I needn't have worried though as my room was guaranteed late arrival and the check-in was fast and efficient. Once inside my room, i was reminded immediately of why I appreciate the Mercure hotels in Rome so much. They all have attractive contemporary decor, a good multi-channel interactive TV system and the most effective and quiet air con I've seen in Rome. Breakfasts were fine, good selection of fruit, bread, croissants, cold meats and cheese. The Mercure's attempt at a cooked breakfast (luminous yellow scrambled eggs and lukewarm greasy bacon) is less impressive. I'm sure they only serve this because they think the many US tour groups staying there would like it. The Mercure has a useful underground parking area, much less congested and easier to get in and out of than at the Mercure Piazza Bologna. I wasn't charged the 20 Euro per day for this, maybe because I paid the rack rate for my room. The surrounding neighbourhood is an affluent residential area, very safe at night. There are not many restaurants in the immediate vicinity, although there are a few pizza places a couple of blocks NE of the hotel. The nearest metro at Piazza Bologna is a 12 minute walk to the south along flat residential streets. No big problem, but yes it could be a bit tiring if you were travelling this way every single day. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: roma1888
Reviews.Content: this hotel, situated in a quiet residential neighbourhood around 10 minutes from the city centre, is definetly where i would stay again the next time i'm in rome! the hotel itself is superbly decorated, staff are always helpful and the rooms spacious and, most importantly, spotless. the breakfast offered was of a wide variety and always fresh. there is also a small gym, sauna and steam room in the hotel which is always handy after a longday in the city. other reviews have noted a few downsides of the hotel, mainly the lack of a restaurant onsite and the location. for us, the variety of snacks offered at the bar (drinks very reasonable compared to other places in the city!!) was more than sufficient as, at the end of the day, why travel to rome and not sample some of the multitude of restaurants on offer around the centre??? also, the location of the hotel was not a problem at all, i found it to be in a nice area, with good bus links into the centre, and the reception staff were always happy to call a taxi, which were relatively inexpensive. also i was delighted to discover that instead of an expensive minibar in the room, there is instead a small fridge, with water provided by the hotel. the rooms were very well maintained, with easy to use internet facilities and a wide variety of television/movie channels to choose from. all in all, the hotel was the perfect place from which to discover the eternal city. p.s. near the hotel there is a small pizzeria, named San Marino, which is frequented by the locals and is simply delicious (and very reasonable!)

Reviews.Title: “Mercure Hotel Corso Trieste”
Reviews.Author: RDBOOK
